page.title: 09TOURISM
page.content: The area is very attractive and therefore attracts a number of tourists, particularly those who are trying to escape from the traditional tourist routes. We passed the pub at Ralegh's Cross at Saturday lunch time in the summer and the tables on the lawn at the front of the pub were full of people eating and enjoying the sunshine. Many wish to retire to the area and some even buy up buildings to use as holiday homes, a practice not liked by the local residents since it raises the price of housing in the area. (A three bedroomed converted cottage would cost about Â£30 000). The TV masts at King's Brompton common have been sprayed with slogans by the Welsh Nationalists in the past since they beam English language programmes to South Wales.
